title: Prefix displayed contact numbers with +91 while preserving working deep links

requirements.summary: Update central (React) contactNumbers to store/display numbers with the "+91 " prefix across the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/content/siteContent.ts, contactNumbers values are updated to include the "+91 " prefix for whatsapp, whatsappSecondary, phone1, and phone2.
ContactPage, ContactSection, and MarketingFooter (and any other React pages/components that display contactNumbers) display the phone numbers with the "+91 " prefix.

file_operations.description: Update contactNumbers.whatsapp, contactNumbers.whatsappSecondary, contactNumbers.phone1, and contactNumbers.phone2 to include the "+91 " prefix (e.g., "+91 7011090796", "+91 9212374300") so all React-rendered UI locations that display these values show the prefixed format.

requirements.summary: Update the standalone non-React landing page contact numbers to include the "+91 " prefix while keeping WhatsApp link generation valid.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/static/growwithtutor-standalone/script.js, CONTENT.contact.whatsapp and CONTENT.contact.phone include the "+91 " prefix.
The standalone page still generates a valid wa.me link by stripping non-digits (resulting in a number like "917011090796").

file_operations.description: Change CONTENT.contact.whatsapp and CONTENT.contact.phone to store/display values with the "+91 " prefix, and confirm the existing non-digit stripping logic used for the wa.me link still produces digit-only numbers (e.g., "917011090796").

requirements.summary: Ensure tel:, sms:, and wa.me deep links continue to use digit-only numbers even after adding the "+91 " prefix to stored contact numbers.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Call Now" uses a tel: link that contains only digits (e.g., tel:917011090796).
Clicking "Send SMS" uses an sms: link that contains only digits (e.g., sms:917011090796...).
Clicking WhatsApp CTAs opens a wa.me link containing only digits (e.g., https://wa.me/917011090796...).

file_operations.description: Harden link-generation helpers (WhatsApp, phone, SMS) to consistently derive digit-only phone numbers from stored values (including those with a "+91 " prefix), ensuring all generated tel:, sms:, and wa.me URLs contain only digits.
Align any manually-constructed tel: links with the shared digit-only phone link generation approach (so that when contactNumbers include "+91 ", tel: links still resolve to digit-only values).
